title: ICE Low Sulphur Gasoil markets hit series of OI records
keypoints: ICE Low Sulphur Gasoil markets achieved open interest records through June 2024.
Open interest reached 1.2 million across futures and options, equivalent to 120 million metric tons.
Year-over-year growth: futures and options open interest up over 40%, trading volumes up 30%.
ICE Gasoil options hit record open interest of 234,570 contracts.
In Q2 2024, 287,421 Gasoil options traded, contributing to a record 16.2 million oil options contracts at ICE.
ICE Gasoil is physically deliverable, with an average of over 100,000 tons entering the delivery process monthly in 2024.
ICEâ€™s global crude and refined product complex includes significant benchmarks like Brent crude and ICE Murban.
The global oil complex open interest at ICE is up over 20%, totaling 14 million contracts.

title: NNPC Ltd Declares State of Emergency on Crude Oil Production
keypoints: NNPC Ltd declared a state of emergency to boost Nigeria's crude oil production and reserves.
Aims to produce 2 million barrels of crude oil per day without new rigs.
Focus on overcoming delays in procurement processes and other production obstacles.
Plans to replace old crude oil pipelines and introduce a rig-sharing program to retain rigs in-country.
NNPC Ltd is investing in midstream gas infrastructure to boost domestic gas production and supply.
The company is also advancing in the Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) sector, commissioning new CNG stations.
Calls for industry collaboration to reduce production costs and boost output.
Emphasized commitment to critical infrastructure projects like the OB3 and Ajaokuta-Kaduna-Kano gas pipelines.

title: EIA reports surge in Iraqi oil exports to the US
keypoints: Iraqi oil exports to the US increased to an average of 217,000 barrels per day (bpd) last week.
This marks an increase of 22,000 bpd from the previous week's average of 195,000 bpd.
The US crude oil imports from nine key countries reached 5.635 million bpd, up by 235,000 bpd from the previous week.
Canada led US oil imports with 3.889 million bpd, followed by Mexico and Saudi Arabia.
EIA data indicates significant contributions from other countries like Colombia, Brazil, Nigeria, Ecuador, and Libya.
